@MikeGrunwald I was at one of the meetings you report.  It wasn't quite the way you describe it. Happy to explain by phone.

@AshokRao95 We should not cut.  We should raise revenues.  And be clear about the framework.
@AshokRao95 We need to show a clear, positive, public-investment-led strategy, properly financed over the course of a decade.

@altmandaniel Indeed. We'd be a lot better off w/ clear distinctions btwn capital & operating budgets in a medium-term fiscal framework.
@deficitowl @Eclectopedic @bill_easterly One that achieves a set of identified goals.  One should link goals, means, and outcomes.
@mehdirhasan I backed his attack on the deficit, but wanted more spending and higher taxes, rather than mainly spending cuts.

@GrossKen Need to move to capitation system of payments.  The current system is corrupt and totally broken.  Must take on health lobby.
@MikeGrunwald Your own book makes clear why the stimulus was so politically toxic. A dead end. Killed transport investment & much more.
@ShaneOFA @NotJustJack @MikeGrunwald Politics can be more than horse trading.  I've seen it many times, just not in the US recently.
@ShaneOFA @NotJustJack @MikeGrunwald Good ideas beat bad ideas hands down.  Get the "political advisors" out of the room. They're toxic.
@ShaneOFA @NotJustJack @MikeGrunwald Don't be so sure. Better than trying to sell lousy idea like cap & trade. Too many gimmicks by Dems.
@MikeGrunwald The stimulus spent on some good things like ARPA-E.  It is not the same thing as an energy plan or policy.

@ShaneOFA @MikeGrunwald Cap and trade is a bad idea.

@ShaneOFA @MikeGrunwald We have "all-of-the-above" energy policy, in other words a sop to every interest group, but no strategy. Sad.
@ShaneOFA @MikeGrunwald  If you worried about a real decarbonization strategy, not a hydrofracking future, you'd be a lot more concerned.
@ShaneOFA @MikeGrunwald I didn't want to end up with permanent Bush tax cuts, no climate policy but "all of the above," & sequestration.
@ShaneOFA @MikeGrunwald The key is to solve problems. Look where we are today on climate/energy/infrastructure.  Adrift.
@ShaneOFA @MikeGrunwald If you do a program that has burst of spending for 2-3 years & then fades away, you will not transform systems.

@vijayaku A progressive must have serious plans and proposals, not ad hoc messes of legislation agreed behind closed doors.
